isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL TANDEM AXLE FORWARD REAR DRIVE UNITS - INSTALL - Checking and Adjusting the End Play of the Input Bearing

svcproc.title: Checking and Adjusting the End Play of the Input Bearing

figure.caption: Figure 150. Checking and Adjusting End Play

svcproc.para: Specification: End Play of the Input Shaft: 0.002 to 0.008 inch (0.050 to 0.200 mm)

step1.para: Install bolts, but not the washers, that fasten the input bearing cage to the carrier. Rotate the input shaft in each direction to make sure the bearings are correctly installed while hand tightening the bolts. DO NOT TIGHTEN THE BOLTS!
Use a feeler gauge to measure the gap between the input bearing cage and the differential carrier housing. Check the gap at four equally spaced places on the cage ( Figure 151).

Add up the four measurements and determine the average gap between the cage and the carrier. Add 0.005 inch (0.13 mm) to the average gap measurement to determine the size of the shim pack between the cage and the carrier.
Use at least three shims when building a shim pack, and always put the thickest shims in the middle of the shim pack.
Remove the bolts that fasten the input bearing cage to the carrier.
Connect a lifting device to the input yoke. Remove the input shaft assembly.
Install the shim pack under the bearing cage. Make sure that the hole pattern of the shim pack matches the hole pattern of the cage ( Figure 152).
Put the shield for the oil filter in position on the bearing cage.

Install the bolts and the washers that fasten the cage to the carrier. Make sure the bolts are aligned with the holes in the shim pack. Tighten the bolts so that the threads engage in the holes of the carrier.
Lower the input shaft assembly so that the cage and the shim pack are installed against the carrier. Remove the lifting device from the yoke or flange.
Tighten the bolts to 75 to 95 ft-lbs. (100 to 127 Nm) while rotating the input shaft in each direction to make sure that the bearings are correctly installed.
Put a holding tool on the input yoke or flange and tighten the nut to the specified torque. Refer to the Torque Chart.
Rotate the input shaft in each direction and push the yoke or flange toward the bearing cage. This makes sure that the input shaft assembly is at the bottom of its travel.

Use a dial indicator with a magnetic base or a C-clamp base to check the end play of the input bearing. Make sure the pointer of the dial indicator is against the top of the input shaft. Set the dial indicator to zero (0) ( Figure 153).

figure.caption: Figure 153. Set Dial Indicator to Zero (0).

step1.para: Use a pry bar and a support to push the yoke or the flange away from the carrier. Read the dial indicator. The reading must be in the 0.002 to 0.008 inch range (0.050 to 0.200 mm) ( Figure 154).

figure.caption: Figure 154. Push Yoke or Flange Away From Carrier

step1.para: If the end play of the input bearing is not within the 0.002 to 0.008 inch range (0.050 to 0.200 mm), add or remove shims from the shim pack. Repeat Steps 5-16 of this procedure.
Remove the input shaft assembly from the carrier.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury when doing Steps 18 and 19, be careful when using Loctite primer N and #518 sealant. Follow the manufacturer's instructions for safe use to prevent irritation to eyes and skin. Wash after skin contact. If the Loctite gets in the eyes, flush the eyes with water for 15 minutes. Have eyes checked by a doctor.

step1.para: Spray Loctite Primer N on the cage and carrier faces around the perimeter of the lube trough hole at the 2 o'clock position ( Figure 155). Allow the primer to dry 3 to 5 minutes.
Apply Loctite 518 to the cage and carrier faces around the lube trough hole ( Figure 155).

figure.caption: Figure 155. Spray Loctite Primer N and Apply Loctite 518

step1.para: Use guide studs to install the input shaft and cage assembly with the appropriate shim pack. Tighten the bolts to 95 ft-lbs. (128 Nm). Use the opposed sequence to tighten the bolts.
Allow 4 hours for the Loctite 518 sealant to cure before returning the vehicle to service.
